alert.note: Alert for Kern; Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 12:26PM PST until March 10 at 1:45PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno, Kern and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 230 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1226 PM PST, rain and snowmelt is occurring, and will cause minor flooding. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Visalia, Tulare, Porterville, Orosi, Lindsay, Farmersville, Exeter, Woodlake, Terra Bella, East Porterville, Three Rivers, Strathmore, Poplar-Cotton Center, Ducor, Woodville, Ivanhoe, East Orosi, Cutler, Lake Isabella and Tipton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
